paper.title: Simple Article
paper.version: Another rewrite. Note that the most recent version goes at the top.

author-bio.p: Brief author bio here. Include an avatar-like photo.

paper.abstract: This article is an example of how to build an article using this toolchain. There is both explanation and example here. This abstract section should be a brief summary that should summarize why the reader should be interested in getting into the rest of the article.

body.p: The article can begin with some summary paragraphs before the sections begin.
I still have to work on providing more explanation and examples of how the publishing toolchain works.

section.p: Documents are divided into sections using the section tag with an h tag used for the section heading

Rather than HTML's numbered headings, in this format I nest sections inside each other - the level of the heading is derived from the nesting.

When building a paper, you can supply a bibliography for citations. You can then include a citation either as a link around text or just stand-alone .

The appendix is separated and rendered slightly differently. It's good for secondary items, acknowledgements, and the like.
